Key: Hmm... Which one should I choose?

That one? If I pick that one, then maybe
this would work too...
No, maybe not... Hm, is this better?
Hmmm...
Hey, Shido-kun. What's the matter? I see\nyou muttering to yourself... *gasp*! Has love\ngot you stressed out?
I mean, you could say th―

...What?! Sh-Shido-san, um... I'll do my best!
I'll do anything, so...!
Huh? Yoshino?!

(When did Yoshino and Yoshinon enter
my room? I-I didn't even notice...)
HEYYY! Shido-kun, what's the meaning of\nthis? Don't tell me you're ignoring Yoshino...\nWhoa. You're a lowlife.
Of course not! I still care about Yoshino!
U-Um, d-did I do something to... upset you?
Hahahahaha. Right. Ever since you became\nYoshino's boyfriend, you've become the talk\nof the town.
What do you mean... talk of the town?
Oh. Well, of course, that instead of hanging\nwith the other girls, you're partial to―
Y-Yoshinon?!

Hey. I like spending time with Yoshino,
and that's why we're friends. I told you.
That's all it is.
Oh... Th-That makes me... happy.
Woohoo! You make me jealous! Way to\nshow me up!

(I'm still figuring out how to deal with
Yoshinon being around all the time. I'm
sure Yoshinon means well, but...)

Anyways, when did you two come into
my room?
Oh. Kotori-san showed us the way...
Where'd Kotori go?
She said she's got stuff to do at the Fraxinus,\nso she asked us to watch the house～
Ah, I see.
Um, do you not want us around...?

Of course I do. I'm just surprised because
I wasn't expecting you.
Now, now. What's a surprise between\nfriends? Guys do it all the time.
(So, they snuck in on purpose.)
U-Um, what were you stressing about...?
Oh, about that...

(I'm sure I could play it off, but Yoshino
would probably worry about it either way.)
(I might as well tell her.)
You know how we plans to go on a date?
Y-Yes...

(Yoshinon is smirking next to her, but I'm
choosing to ignore it.)
Well, I'm not exactly sure where to take you.
(Yoshino and Yoshinon cocked their heads.)
Um, and does that... bother you?
I don't think Yoshino cares, do ya Yoshino?
R-Right...

I figured Yoshino would say that, but that
stresses me out even more.

(I'm sure she doesn't mind where we go.
Yoshino's open-minded and isn't one to complain.
But that doesn't give me an answer.)

I wanted to be like, "HERE'S A PLACE!
But I just couldn't decide."
...I see.
I seeee. Shido-kun, you seem to be putting in a\nlot of effort! Take a look at all those pamphlets.\nAre you that excited to hang out with Yoshino?

(Sprawled across my desks were several
guidebooks and pamphlets.)

(Among them was a "gal game", but I swear
it's not mine.)
Yeah. Everyone lent these to me.

(I borrowed them Ratatoskr, of course.
If I screw up my time with Yoshino, they'd
never let me hear the end of it.)
Hmm, let's see... Movies, boutiques, eateries.\nAll very typical. I kinda get the sense you're\ntrying too hard.

Oh, there's amusement parks... The zoo,
and aquarium, too...

(I think Reine-san or Kotori suggested those.
They sound legitimate.)
Y-Yeah. Those sound pretty good.

(I put the non-conventional options inside
of my desk drawer.)
Hehehe. Right. You hid all the good stuff\naway from Yoshino, huh?
Um... what places are... too good?

Hahaha. Places like that are too much for a student
like me.
(Planning a trip is worse than pulling teeth.)

(But if Yoshinon is here to scrutinize, then
I need to be mindful of what I show to
Yoshino.)

(Hm...? I wonder. Yoshinon's vision is only
as good as Yoshino's. If she isn't watching me,
then am I safe?)
(Man, I'm distracting myself right now.)

Is there somewhere you wanted to go,
Yoshino? Anywhere. Doesn't have to be
on the pamphlets.
Huh? Where I want to go...?
Mm. It's your first date, so be confident\nand lead the way. That's what a man would\ndo.
Y-Yoshinon...!

When you put it that way, I feel bad. I just
want us to have equal input. Otherwise,
what's the point, you know?
Hehehe. Don't wanna make a bad first\nimpression, right? I totally get it. Yup, yup.

Hey. It's not like our first time hanging out.
All I want is for both of us to have a great
time. Is that so much to ask?
Huh? Oh, r-right...

So, got any suggestions, Yoshino? Don't
hold back.
Hmm. All these options are overwhelming.\nShido-kun, can't you think of something?\nIt's not like you don't have ideas.

We visited the pool the other day, so maybe
we could avoid it this time.

(I'm trying my damndest to avoid Yoshinon's
subtle hints.)

Maybe the zoo or the aquarium would
work. It'd be nice to go some place where
we could walk at our own pace.
Oh, um...

I had a feeling you might find it crowded
though, Yoshino. If there's a movie you
wanted to see, we could do that!
Well, Yoshino doesn't normally walk in\ncrowds by herself, so maybe this is a good\nopportunity to stretch our legs.

Or maybe we can go shopping? If you
needed to update your wardrobe, I could
carry your bags for you.
Um, all of that sounds fun, but...
Hm? What's the matter?
My only... wish is to be with you, Shido-san.
Yoshino...
Woohoo ♪  You're so sweet. Shido-kun, how\nlucky are you, huh? What are you gonna do\nabout it?
I don't know. I mean, it is nice of her to say.

(It's just that I can tell Yoshino wasn't
really into any of my suggestions.)
Tsk, tsk, tsk. Shido-kun, you don't get it.\nI can't trust you with Yoshino like this.
S-Sorry...
No need to apologize. Besides, it's true\nthat Yoshino has fun wherever you are.

About that. If that's sincere, we could go
anywhere, but we should avoid places that
Yoshino wouldn't like... Hm?

Wait. Does that mean we don't have to force
ourselves to go out...?
Ah, Shido-kun. You get it. Exactly. That's it.

(Yoshino is very shy. She only got used to
Kotori and Tohka recently, but she's not
too good with strangers.)

(And if we were to go somewhere unfamiliar
to her, she would be overwhelmed by all the
new people.)

U-Um, I... I'm fine with your suggestions.
I bet I can have fun with you anywhere.

The minute you say "I'm fine" leads me to
believe you are unsatisfied.
Huh? Oh, um, well...

Maybe we should think of places where
other people won't bother us.
What?! Sh-Shido-san, does that mean―?
Huh? Shido-kun, is that what you want?\nBeing alone with Yoshino when no one\nelse is around? Jeez, Shido-kun. Bold!
...Y-Yoshinon?!
Huh? OH! That's not what I meant!
Aw, then what DO you mean? Come on!\nSpit it out!

I mean, we can still hang out, but I don't
mind if we spend time at home.
Hm. I see. Well, being alone inside of\na boy's room is nerve-wracking.

My room's fine, but there's nothing to do
here.
U-Um, but you'll be here...
Yoshino...
Shido-san...
AHEM! Well, whatever works. Why don't\nyou to strike up some cute conversation?

Wh-What are you saying? That's not what
we were getting at!
Oh, whaaaat? She's here. You embarrassed?
N...No!
...Am I wrong?
W-Well, it's not wrong, but...
Oh, ho? Well, whatever.

(There are so many weird implications here,
but if I worry about it, I'll look weird.)
U-Um, please lead the way, Shido-san.

(With that, we decided to stay home instead
of planning a grand date.)
(On the day of...)
Hey, hey! Shido-kun! Yoshino has arrived!
Yoshinon?!

Hey, welcome... I mean, you guys do live
next door.
So close, yet so far. Can you picture how\nunbearable that is?
Yoshino's been nervous since last night.\nAs soon as she got up, she hopped into the\nbath.
(Oh. That explains the fragrant scent.)
U-Um, w-well, um...

Hahaha. Make yourselves at home. It's not
like we're doing anything crazy.
So you say. Shido-kun. You're keeping\na secret, aren't you?
Wh-What are you talking about?! Of course not!
Hoo boy. Then Shido-kun, what's on the\nitinerary?

Well, about that. I hope you like this,
Yoshino.
Um, is that a DVD?
Yeah. I've got a bunch.
None of them look rented. So, are these\nyour kinda flicks, Shido-kun?
...They are all for women.
Oh. My friend lent those to me.
Oh, really? Any recommendations?
Well, I haven't watched all of them...
Man, then you haven't done your research.
Sorry...

(Realizing right now that I slipped and had
told Kotori about what we're doing today.)

(Even though we're just at home, because
I didn't make concrete "plans", Kotori called
me in for an emergency meeting.)

(Then, she lent me stacks of movies to kill
time. I kinda picked whatever looked good.)
Heeeey, Shido-kuuun? You're staring.\nWhat's the matter?
Um. Are you tired...?
O-Oh. Nothing. I'm fine.
Oh, okay...

Kotori's out today, so don't worry about
her. Just make yourselves at home.
If that is the case, I will...

If you're not interested in any of these DVDs,
we don't have to watch them.
Yeah, but I think one or two of 'em caught\nYoshino's eye.
Oh, really?
Yup. She's especially interested in the\nromance ones. In that sense, you've got\na good eye, Shido-kun!
Haha. Well, I'm glad.

Um, I'm interested in them... not just because
they have good stories...
Hm? Then why is that?

Um... I-I'm not experienced with dating... So I
thought... it'd be a good way to study.
Yoshino...

I don't really know... what to do...  I want to
learn... so I don't embarrass myself.
Don't worry about that. Just be your―

(As I said that, Yoshinon made eye contact
with me.)
Just be what? Come on, out with it! What\nwere you going to say?

Well, if you find a movie you like, then
let's pop it in.
Jeez, Shido-kun! Such a tease!
Then, how about this one...?

(Yoshino grabbed a foreign drama that was
released quite a few years ago...)
Sure. Why'd you pick that one?
U-Um, I've heard of it, but I never watched it...
Yoshino doesn't go into rental shops by\nherself.

(She should just ask Kotori to grab it for
her, but I guess for Yoshino it's a matter
of principle.)

Then, from now on, we can visit the store
together.
Oh, okay...!

(I flashed a kind smile at Yoshino, to which
she returned a warm grin. Yoshinon, on the
other hand, gave me a funny look.)
Oh, um, I have tea and snacks.
Shido-kun, you could be bolder. I mean,\nit's just you two here.

(I ignored Yoshinon's taunts. I opened the
DVD case, sat next to Yoshino on the sofa,
and pressed play.)

(I, too, had heard of the foreign film we
were watching, but I never went to see
it.)

(Not in a rude way, but I found it unexpectedly
entertaining.)
...I thought it'd be cheesier, but it wasn't.
(We finished the film, and I swapped the disc.)
Yeah, totally. I was expecting a total rom-com,\nbut it ended up being more of a coming-of-age.\nDidn't see it coming.
U-Um, Shido-san... Are you bored?
Of course not. I'm ready for more.
I see. I'm glad.
(Yoshino sighed with relief.)
Yoshino, was it what you expected?

Yes, it was. But at the same time, I am
curious about what happens after.

(This time, she wasn't using her usual
rehearsed line. Looks like Yoshino is
actually enjoying herself.)
I see. Then let's keep going.
Oh, um...
Hm? Wanna take a break?
I'm not tired, but, um... can I ask you a favor?
Sure. What's up?
Um...
Is it tough to ask?
Hehehe. It's not what you're expecting,\nShido-kun.
What am I expecting...?
Oh, come on. Don't play dumb. Yoshino,\nI think you should spit it out.

I mean, if you need something, I don't mind
helping you. Just let me know.
U-Um, what were they doing in the drama...?
Hm?

(Wh-What is she referring to? The story
is about careerism, but there were a lot
of scenes with couples, too.)

(Some pretty risque ones, too. What was
Yoshino hoping for...?)
(I started turning red just thinking about it.)
U-Um, are you okay?
Y-Yeah. I think so...?
Okay... I'm glad.
PFFFT! Oh, Shido-kun. Were you hoping for\nsomething?

Wh-what do you mean?! I wasn't hoping
for anything!
Wh-What are you thinking of...?
W-Well, it's nothing really.
Right, right. Shido-kun, you don't seem like\nmuch of a self-starter.
Y-Yeah. Guess not.

U-Um. S-Sorry for saying... that I want you
to lie on my lap.
Th-That's fine. It wasn't weird at all!

(Even with the movie playing, I can barely
focus on the TV.)
Th-Thank you.
No need to thank me.
That's right. This is a date after all. If you\ncan't be friendly, then what's the point?
The point...?
A-Anyway, how's your lap? Am I heavy?
U-Um, I'm fine. Because it's you, Shido-san...

Let me know if your legs get numb, okay?
I mean, it's happened to me before.
I-It has?

Yeah. When Kotori and I were kids, she'd
fall on my lap like this when we watched
TV.
When you were kids...?
Hey, Earth to Shido-kun. You're here with\nYoshino. It's bad taste to bring up other\ngirls.
My sister doesn't count, does she?
Hmm. Dubious.
Of course not.
Gotcha. If she says so. But you aren't\ntalking enough about how soft her lap\nis.
...I can't really say.
U-Um, I'm sorry...

I mean, it's not often that I place my head
on someone's lap. But, uh, it's nice.
I-I see. Glad to hear it.

(I mean, I just feel awkward sitting on
someone's lap who's so much shorter
than me.)

(I couldn't move, so I continued watching
from this crooked angle.)
Oh, I'm sorry...

(Yoshino ran her finger through my hair,
and I froze.)
N-No, it's fine. Just tickled.
O-Okay.

(Yoshino put her hand on my head and
wouldn't stop. I didn't hate it, but it made
me feel more self-conscious.)
Hehehe. What's the matter? You look kinda\nuncomfortable Shido-kun.
Well, um, that's not true.
Oh, um... Do you want to stop?

I mean, I don't hate it, but I'm not used to
it.
Whaaaaat? You flirt with so many girls and\nyou're afraid of a little petting?

Why do you seem so surprised? I mean,
even hanging out with Yoshino makes me
nervous...
...That's a relief.
Oh... Really? Sorry.

Oh, no. I wasn't talking about you being
friendly with other girls.

But the fact... you're also... nervous when
you're with me.
Jeez, Shido-kun. You're useless on that\nfront.
...Sorry.

I-I didn't say... it was bad. I just feel...
relieved.
...Yeah? I feel so pathetic.

U-Um, I wouldn't like it... if you were used to
this.

You wouldn't? I was just thinking to myself
that I wished I was there for you more.
Shido-san, you're always there for me...
...You think so?

Yes. If not, I don't think... I would have fallen
for you.
...Thank you, Yoshino.
U-Um...
Woohoo! Oh, Yoshino. You're gonna tell\nhim? My, someone's feeling bold.
I...  I like you too.
...Oh! I appreciate that...

(We looked at one another, giggling as the
ending credits played on the TV.)
Oh, the show's over.
Should we... rewatch it?
Right...

(While Yoshino pet me on her lap, I fell
into a state of relaxation. I was soothed,
and suddenly felt very sleepy.)
...Shido-san?
Mm...
Ahh. Shido-kun looks sleepy. Actually, he's\nalready passed out. He's horrible.
That's not true... Shido-san is...
Shido-kun is what...?
...An amazing person.

(As I fell into a slumber, I thought I could
hear them talking, but it might have been
the TV.)

(I let the day wash over me, and slipped
into a deep sleep.)
